ðŸŒŸ voice-transcribe-summarize-telegram-bot | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Transcribe and summarize voice notes from Telegram using AI models
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Transcribe voice notes from forwarded messages â€¢ Handle direct voice note recordings â€¢ Generate accurate transcriptions using Whisper â€¢ Provide concise summaries of the transcribed content using Llama 3 â€¢ Support for multiple audio formats
ðŸ“– Summary: This Telegram bot uses Groq's API with Whisper and Llama 3 to transcribe and summarize voice notes. It supports both forwarded and directly sent voice notes and provides well-formatted output to the user. The bot is built with Python and requires a Telegram Bot Token and Groq API Key.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ best-of-n-prompt-jailbreaker | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Jailbreaking AI models by generating effective prompts through the BoN algorithm
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Implements Best-of-N Jailbreaking (BoN) method â€¢ Generates transformed prompts to exploit AI model vulnerabilities â€¢ Provides a web demo and a library for prompt generation
ðŸ“– Summary: This repository provides a Best-of-N jailbreaking prompt generator. It uses the BoN algorithm to transform input prompts, creating prompts that can potentially exploit vulnerabilities in AI models. A web demo and a library are available for use.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ web-player | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: A web-based music player supporting local files and YouTube downloads.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Automatic track switching â€¢ Track deletion â€¢ Track shuffling â€¢ YouTube import (download) â€¢ Track information display
ðŸ“– Summary: This repository contains a web-based music player application. It allows users to play music from local storage and import tracks from YouTube. The application includes features such as track shuffling, a sleep timer, and detailed logging capabilities.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ E4GL30S1NT | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Information gathering and OSINT
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ username reconnaissance â€¢ facebook information dumping â€¢ email finding â€¢ google dorking â€¢ phone number information retrieval
ðŸ“– Summary: This repository contains a Python-based tool for performing various OSINT tasks, including username and email searches, IP geolocation, and domain lookups. It leverages several APIs (requiring API keys) to enhance its capabilities. The tool is installable on Linux and Termux.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ deepseek-r1-chat | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: AI-powered coding assistant providing intelligent coding assistance, debugging help, and programming guidance.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Python Expert â€¢ Debugging Assistant â€¢ Code Documentation â€¢ Solution Design â€¢ Runs 100% locally
ðŸ“– Summary: DeepSeek Code Companion is an AI-powered coding assistant that runs locally. It offers features like Python code completion, debugging, documentation generation, and solution design. The application uses the DeepSeek-r1 language model via Ollama for local model serving.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ vite-react-tailwind-bionic-reading | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Enhance reading experience by highlighting the beginning of words, aiding focus and comprehension.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Bionic reading implementation to improve reading comprehension â€¢ Save as PDF functionality â€¢ Unicode support â€¢ Variable font size
ðŸ“– Summary: This project implements bionic reading, allowing users to enhance their reading experience. Key features include saving text as a PDF, Unicode character support, and adjustable font sizes. The tool aims to improve reading comprehension by drawing attention to the beginning of each word.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ spack | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Building and installing software packages with multiple versions and configurations across various platforms.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Multi-platform package manager â€¢ Builds and installs multiple versions and configurations of software â€¢ Works on Linux, macOS, Windows, and many supercomputers
ðŸ“– Summary: Spack is a cross-platform package manager that enables building and installing multiple versions of software packages. It supports Linux, macOS, Windows, and supercomputers, and its non-destructive nature allows for the coexistence of various package configurations. A simple spec syntax and Python-based package files streamline the process.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ GoFreeDB | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Using Google Sheets as a database
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Provides key-value and row-based database interfaces on top of Google Sheets â€¢ Allows data serving without server setup by leveraging Google Sheets infrastructure â€¢ Supports a flexible query language for data queries â€¢ Enables manual data manipulation via the Google Sheets UI
ðŸ“– Summary: GoFreeDB is a Golang library offering key-value and row-based database functionalities using Google Sheets. It eliminates the need for server setup and provides a flexible query language. Data can be managed directly through the familiar Google Sheets interface.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ Meerkat | PowerShell
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Incident response and threat hunting on Windows systems
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Artifact gathering â€¢ Reconnaissance of Windows endpoints â€¢ PowerShell modules â€¢ Incident response triage â€¢ Threat hunting
ðŸ“– Summary: Meerkat is a collection of PowerShell modules designed for efficient artifact gathering and reconnaissance on Windows endpoints without needing a pre-deployed agent. It's useful for incident response, threat hunting, and security monitoring tasks, enabling analysis of various system artifacts like processes, services, files, and registry keys.
